content: elizabeth smith k n i t s semi-charmed scarf icord edged 3-color scarf pattern info semi-charmed scarf takes the basic garter stitch scarf techniques/tips and adds a little charm by integrating a slip_stitch icord edge this little detail gives this basic accessory long tail cast-on i like using the thumb a more tailored appearance and it s fun to make method of this cast-on view my video tutorial pattern is written for 3 colors but you can use just 1 here https //bit ly/39tap31 or 2 if you prefer or more icord edge view my tutorial here i use finished measurements version 3 of this technique for this pattern https //bit ly/2jmgdt3 6 /15 cm x 58 /147 cm sl2 slip the next 2 sts from ln to rn as if to purl gauge changing colors tip although i usually 14 sts & 30 row = 4 /10 cm in garter stitch recommend knitting the first stitch with both the old color and the new color when switching yarn approx 270 yds of bulky-weight yarn show colors because of the icord edge here i in titan bulky by at haynes house yarns 100% recommend just joining the new color and superwash merino 100g = 106 yds approx 90 yds knitting with just that color to start just make sure for each of 3 colors shown in colors to leave a long tail so you can weave in ends well and tighten up any looseness that may appear color a curry goat 1 skein color b the good ice 1 skein weaving in ends i love using the duplicate stitch color c gray not grey 1 skein to weave in ends in garter stitch view my photo tutorial here https //bit ly/2lp4yyd you can find their beautiful yarn here https //athayneshouseyarns com/ needles & other supplies us 10 5/6 5 mm 24 /60 cm circ or straight needle or size needed to obtain gauge tapestry needle to weave in ends stitch patterns garter stitch knit all row abbreviations approx = approximately bobble = bind off circ = circular co = cast on k = knit ln = left needle p = purl rn = right needle rs = right side sl = slip st s = stitch es ws = wrong side wyib = with yarn in back wyif = with yarn in front www elizabethsmithknits com 2 instructions section 1 with color a co 24 sts row 1 rs k to last 2 sts sl2 wyib row 2 ws p2 k to last 2 sts sl2 wyif repeat row 1-2 until measures approx 19 5 /50 cm cut color a note make note of how many ridges you have at this point - in my sample i had 67 ridges section 2 on the next row you will join & knit
